ResourceHeader.ResourceName: GEOS-1 Ultra Low Frequency Magnetic Field Components Level-2 (RFF)
ResourceHeader.Description: This  dataset contains magnetic field components  from GEOS-1 S-300 wave experiment (search coil magnetometer) given in SRV Coordinate System in nT. Time resolution is 43 ms. The data format is RFF (Roproc File Format ftp://ftp.lpp.polytechnique.fr/robert/keep/Biblio_et_CV/Working_documents/2015_Robert_The_Roproc_File_Format_V2p3.pdf)
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement:
Users of these data are encouraged to acknowledge ESA/ESTEC (European Space Agency / European Space Research and Technology Center), DSRI (Danish Space Research Institute), CNES (Centre National d'Etudes Spatiales) for their support to the SCM GEOS team, NASA/GSFC (National Aeronautics and Space Administration / Goddard Space Flight Center) and CNR (Consiglio Nazionale delle Ricerche) for their support to the MAG GEOS team, and the CDPP (Centre des Données de la Physique des Plasmas) for the distribution of the GEOS data, in all publications.

If PI/coI are not part of the publication list, then we suggest to add Specifically, we acknowledge Roger Gendrin and Patrick Robert for use of SCM data from the GEOS mission.

Parameter.Name: Spin Phase Angle
Parameter.Description: Spin Phase is given in the S/C system and S/C sens

Parameter.Name: Magnetic field components  in SRV coordinate system
Parameter.Description:
Magnetic field components  in SRV coordinate system. 
Bx, By, Bz: Magnetic field,
Dx, Dy: despin signals corresponding to the continuous magnetic field rotation.

VDH frame (Vertical Dusk Horizontal system)
The V-axis is the outwards local vertical, to the point of observation.The H-axis is parallel to the horizontal local plane, positive to the North.The V-H plane is a geographic meridian plane.  The D-axis is azimuthal, eastwards.
SRV frame
Z aligned with the spin axis
X is in the geographic meridian plane (V,H) of the VDH frame
Parameter.Caveats:
Note that Dx and Dy are truncated from the raw signal before numerisation.
The conversion to Volt units is given by Bx(V) = -(Bx*5.1/255.0 - 2.5)/Gx and Dx(V) = (Dx*5.1/255.0 -2.5)/10.0
